titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Dodgers team photographs V1987.019
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-01-30T10:22-0500

physdesc.extent: in one folder and one oversize box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Five photographs, dated 1953, with Brooklyn Dodgers team photographs. One group portrait of the 1953 team is included, as well as individual photographs of Jackie Robinson, Pee Wee Reese, and manager Charlie Dressen.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Based on the date range of this collection, all items in the collection will enter the public domain by 2073. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Dodgers team photographs, V1987.019, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society holds additional manuscript and photographic collections related to the Brooklyn Dodgers. Consult with library staff for more information.
